meanings.definition: A person who performs or carries out a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The executant completed the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The diligent executant always follows through on their responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The executant made sure the job was done, even if it meant working late.
meanings.sent4: She was the executant of the plan, ensuring every detail was executed perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The executant's efficiency and dedication were truly admirable.

meanings.definition: One who executes a will or legal document.
meanings.sent1: The executant was responsible for carrying out the deceased's wishes.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer acted as the executant of the will, ensuring it was executed correctly.
meanings.sent3: The executant carefully reviewed the legal document to avoid any mistakes.
meanings.sent4: As the executant, he held the important task of fulfilling the terms of the will.
meanings.sent5: The executant's role was crucial in ensuring the proper distribution of assets.
